properties.name: 1st time in EUROPE
properties.description: Posted by Marybethmunich, germanyI was 13 years old and it was my first time across seas. This was one of the best times I have shared with both of my parents.It was actually the first time I drank beer(more than a sip) too, but of course I didn\'t like the taste then. At the time, I was grossly obssesed with the Holocaust, so we made the journey out to Ausweiz and a few of the smaller camps. Seeing where the devastation occured made a huge impact on me. Germany althogether is such a historically rich place that when I cam home I had a new appreciation for traveling.

properties.name: AUSTRIA
properties.description: Posted by MarybethVienna, AustriaWe went through Austria in a day or two- it was a side trip from Germany. I just remember the beautiful old buildings and all of the green.

properties.name: Bermuda Family Trip
properties.description: Posted by MarybethÂ I was in Bermuda with my bother & dad around the age of 15. We were the ultimate tourists here, rented scooters and everything. What still sticks in my mind about this trip are the amazing smells, the crystal blue water and the snorkeling.

properties.name: CHRISTMAS 2004
properties.description: Posted by MarybethVancouverMy brother, dad and I all spent Christmas in Vancouver my junior year of high school. We went snowboarding in Whistler at Mt. Blackcomb for a week and then spent Christmas in Vancouver. It was an experience I will never forget.

properties.name: EXCHANGE
properties.description: Posted by MarybethromeI was an exchange student in Rome, Italy the summer before my junior year. Rome has to be one of the most historically beautiful places in Europe, in my opinion. The best part of this experience for me was being a part of a real Italian family.Not only did I see all of the sites but I experienced the true essence of the Italian culture, their family life.

properties.name: HOME
properties.description: Posted by Marybeth2450 hillside dr., fortuna, caThis is my house in northern California.

properties.name: LONDON
properties.description: Posted by MarybethLondon, EnglandI visited London with my Dad and youngest(but older) brother, Brad. This trip was so amazing! The company my dad works for, State Farm, actually takes a "Millionaire" trip every year and brings their top salesmen along who qualify. As long as I can remember State Farm has taken the Brown family on some really neat adventures, this was probably the best one so far. It was a bonding experience for the three of us. Needless to say I would go back in a heartbeat. The culture was so charming. I loved walking down cobble stone streets, with pubs linning the streets, flower boxes adorning every window.

properties.name: NOVA SCOTIA
properties.description: Posted by MarybethI think I was about 9 years old when my parents took us on this trip. We went with a few other family friends. Sadly,all that I can remember is taking a ferry there and then camping in all of these really green areas. Oh but I do remember the dads bought live lobster and we cooked them at our campsite. It was, and still is, the only time I have ever seen a lobster in pain. I wish I could remember more.

properties.name: PRAGUE
properties.description: Posted by MarybethPragueMy Mom and I actually met up in London, during my trip with my dad and brother. We flew to Prague together and spent a week touring the city before bording the Catarina Von Bora.We spent ten days on this little cruise boat, floating down the river, stopping in little German towns along the way. The final stop for the Catarina Von Bora was Berlin.

properties.name: VIRGIN ISLANDS
properties.description: Posted by MarybethI was really young for this trip, maybe 3. My memory doesn\'t extend past the family photos. According to the pictures there were great white sand beaches, peacocks,and me wearing my brothers underwear. It looked like a lot of fun!
